intro: Zygotritonia, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their rosettes of fleshy, often velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple, pink, and white. Zygotritonia species are popular as houseplants due to their compact size and ability to thrive in indoor conditions with moderate light and humidity. They belong to the family Gesneriaceae and are known for their ability to produce offsets, which can be propagated easily.
